author: Daniel Greene
description:
Amazon dominates the book industry—from eBooks and audiobooks to print sales and self-publishing. Big thank you to Squarespace for sponsoring today's video. Be sure to checkout https://www.squarespace.com/danielgreene But behind its convenience is a monopoly that’s hurting authors, publishers, and readers. From slashing royalties and manipulating algorithms to downgrading Kindles and removing ownership of digital books, Amazon’s grip on the industry is making reading worse for everyone.

In this video, I break down how Amazon is harming the future of books—and what we can do about it.

Topics Covered:
Amazon’s Monopoly: How Kindle Direct Publishing (KDP) controls the market.
Royalties Are Shrinking: How much authors actually earn on
title: How Amazon is Ruining Reading
